channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tarmac and water meter cover well below level of rest of (uneven) pavement., 28th February
item.description:
22 Willow Road Charlton Kings. We moved here 2 years ago but the difference in level has really become a problem for me since a knee injury. This is a particular low spot which catches pedestrians out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Willow Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Big pot hole as you turn into daisybank, 28th February
item.description:
As soon as you turn off Leckhampton hill to go onto daisybank Road there is a big pot hole deeper then 75mm I would say, I was going for a run and I turnt into there and twisted my ankle due to this. Needs to be fixed asap as it could ruin someone’s car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 propane gas cylinders dumped in hedgerow, 28th February
item.description:
Fly tipping creating eyesore and possible hazard if not empty

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Potholes, 28th February
item.description:
Not just one but he whole road is an absolute mess. There are more potholes than smooth surface to drive on. It needs resurfacing in full.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 190, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 28th February
item.description:
A pothole in Lane 1, No further than 50 ft away from the last one that was reported and fixed. It somewhere after J10 southbound, but I don't have an exact location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes throughout Langton close, 28th February
item.description:
One deep pot hole on junction out of Langton close onto insley gardens with 2 smaller near this. Throughout Langton close 19 pot holes of varying sizes have been counted with 9 of these being deeper as pictured most of these are around halfway down the close where it is slightly wider and is often used as a turning point

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langton Close, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water continuously overflowing from manhole cover on bank outside church, 28th February
item.description:
Outside St Martin’s church Woolstonw. Despite numerous reports and visits by your contractors, this problem remains unresolved with torrents of water pouring down the road carrying a loads of mud from damaged verges. the drain needs proper exploration via an endoscope or digging out. It is clearly blocked either by roots or the piping has collapsed. It was apparently marked priority but still after months has not been sorted out. This level of non-service is disgraceful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow Lines on Merstones Drive, 28th February
item.description:
These are so worn out that people are ignoring them and parking causing major issues at peak times for traffic travelling to and from the Merestones estate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Merestones Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light hidden in treees opposite 2-4 Merestones Drive, 28th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Merestones Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Round drain after second traffic calming bumps, 28th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Merestones Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Bottom half of road sign on A4019 Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham defaced with blue graffiti (paint), 27th February
item.description:
Green-backed distance (mileage) sign on westbound carriageway of A4019 Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham – a few yards from Gateway Retail Park (Currys etc) and on opposite side of dual carriageway from M&S Food. What3Words location = bleak.sleep.funds. Seen on Tue 27th Feb 2024. Note that the photos attached are from Google Street View and pre-date the graffiti.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Five potholes scattered along northern section of Andover Street, Cheltenham, 27th February
item.description:
There a five potholes, getting deeper quite quickly, in the northern section of ANDOVER STREET between Andover Road and Suffolk Road. They are along the middle section of the road. The potholes start where the good surface ends outside the former Cleveley Garage premises, now flats, and continue northwards..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Andover Street, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 239b, London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
